title: How to Make a PVC Desktop Light Box

steps.headline: Be sure that you have a flat surface to work on and that it is protected from any drops of the PVC glue.
Glue one of the elbows to one of the straight pieces.
Making sure the pieces that you have are flat on a sturdy surface, put PVC on the inside of the elbow, ensure that it is lined up correctly, and then add the elbow to the end of the tube.
Lay the connected pieces on a protected flat surface, apply the glue to the elbow and while making sure that everything is flat, push in the PVC tube.
Add a third pipe to what you have, while making sure that everything lays flat on the table.
Continue on until you have what you see here.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Repeat the process until you have two of them.
steps.description: Always visualise mentally if the elbows are facing the correct way. With PVC glue, there are no second chances.

steps.headline: Connect the two pieces together with the last remaining tubes.
steps.description: This will make a type of shell for you to put your diffusing material on.

text:
Be sure that you have a flat surface to work on and that it is protected from any drops of the PVC glue. Glue one of the elbows to one of the straight pieces. Making sure the pieces that you have are flat on a sturdy surface, put PVC on the inside of the elbow, ensure that it is lined up correctly, and then add the elbow to the end of the tube. Lay the connected pieces on a protected flat surface, apply the glue to the elbow and while making sure that everything is flat, push in the PVC tube. Add a third pipe to what you have, while making sure that everything lays flat on the table. Continue on until you have what you see here. This is what will happen if you don't make an effort to make sure everything is straight. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/64\/Make-a-PVC-Desktop-Light-Box-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-PVC-Desktop-Light-Box-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/64\/Make-a-PVC-Desktop-Light-Box-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-PVC-Desktop-Light-Box-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Repeat the process until you have two of them. Always visualise mentally if the elbows are facing the correct way. With PVC glue, there are no second chances. Connect the two pieces together with the last remaining tubes. This will make a type of shell for you to put your diffusing material on. Finished.
